Read more'}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Hi', 'Rating': '1.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': 'Tello says phone doesn’t have the correct bands', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024', 'Review Body': "This Artfone mobile phone description on Amazon states that it works with Tello. It states it has Volte and has the bands that should work on Tello.  The baffling thing is that I purchased the phone on Amazon, got a SIM card from Tello, activated and called the phone with my other cell phone, and this Artfone worked fine. Then, I sent the phone to a relative who it was actually purchased for, and it now won’t work.  When I called Tello’s customer service, they told me the phone doesn’t have the correct bands even though the description on Amazon states it does.  Additionally, the IMEI code and service area where the phone was (where I live) and where my relative lives all indicate that the phone should work.  This was all checked on Tello’s website and all came up that the phone should work.Companies don’t actually want you to call them. They want you to do everything online.  Then,  when you check everything online, they later tell you the phone is not compatible.  Even though you checked everything Tello stated you needed on their website for the phone to be compatible before purchasing it, it won’t work.  This is even after you entered the IMEI number from the phone, purchased and put in a Tello SIM card as well as activated and tested the phone and it worked temporarily, it now doesn’t.  My question is why?  Why did it work at first and now it won’t and I’m told it doesn't have the right bands? As far as I’m concerned Amazon or Tello should refund me the cost of the phone because both websites were misleading.  Furthermore, Tello should refund me for their SIM card and the cost of a couple of months of their service.  I never write reviews, but I think others should know what happened to me even after I did my due diligence.  I also emailed Tello a couple of different times to confirm what their customer service representative told me on the phone, and all answers were that the phone doesn’t have the correct bands.  This is even though I provided them Amazon’s listing that stated the phone did have the necessary bands.  They had nothing to say other than the phone doesn’t have the correct bands.  There was no apology for their site still telling me the IMEI will work and I’ll get service in the area the phone is.  I don’t know how Tello keeps customers this way, but I now see a few recent Amazon reviews stating that others had difficulties with Tello and this phone.  These reviews were not there when I bought the phone and I actually wonder if the phone did work with Tello a couple of months ago and now no longer works.Zero stars.

On peut en mettre deux si on le souhaite, donc deux numéros différents.Il est très simple a paramétrer, et très simple d'usage, tout est fait pour que les séniors soit aidés dans l'utilisation.Les touches sur lesquelles on appuie répètent oralement le chiffre pour être sur de ne pas se tromper.Il y a un bouton SOS derrière qui lorsqu'il est pressé appel le numéro préenregistré.La batterie est d'une très longue durée si l'on oublie de le remettre en charge régulièrement. Et le téléphone émet un bip lorsque la batterie vient à etre trop déchargée, ce qui signale qu'il faut le remettre en charge.J'ai acheté ce téléphone pour mon beau père, atteint de la maladie de Parkinson, il est très content de son fonctionnement simplifié, de ses grosses touches, et de l'aide à la composition des numéro. Tout est fait pour qu'il puisse s'en servir seul.Il est ravi, et nous aussi, puisque enfin il possède un téléphone dans lequel il entend bien et qu'il peut emporter partout avec lui sans le perdre.Je vous le recommande.

Biggest issue is keyboard size and accuracy. I use a lot of swipe and predictive keyboard. Phone still great for daily useI was tired of carrying around gigantic phones - but still needed Android for apps, android auto, and a decent camera. After looking around a bunch decided on picking this up. Also considered the Jelly but this seemed to have a better phone and more features. Feels great in your hand - but pretty thick compared to conventional devices. Height is perfect. Has everything you need - NFC payments, Face ID, fingerprint, a decent rear speaker, and pretty solid rear and front cameras. Works with Google Fi.My biggest issue is a really long lag after you take a picture while it seems to be saving it. Feels like 8-10s seconds. You can't take another photo and it seems to not save the photo if you switch out of the camera app too fast. It's a few less seconds if you decrease the default file size to 5 MP. The 48 MP shots take a really long time to save. Seems to do better with some 3rd party camera apps but still an issue. \xa0Ich bin absolut begeistert von meinem neuen DOOGEE V30T Smartphone! Dieses Gerät hat mich in vielerlei Hinsicht überzeugt und ich kann es kaum erwarten, meine Erfahrungen zu teilen.Zunächst einmal ist das Design des V30T modern und ansprechend. Die schlanke Silhouette und die hochwertigen Materialien verleihen ihm einen edlen Look. Das Display ist lebendig und gestochen scharf, was die Nutzung zu einem wahren Vergnügen macht. Die Farben sind kräftig und die Helligkeit passt sich automatisch an verschiedene Lichtverhältnisse an.Die Leistung dieses Smartphones hat mich wirklich umgehauen. Dank des leistungsstarken Prozessors läuft alles butterweich und reaktionsschnell. Das Multitasking funktioniert einwandfrei, selbst bei anspruchsvollen Anwendungen und Spielen. Die Kamera des V30T ist eine weitere Stärke. Die Fotos sind gestochen scharf und die Farbwiedergabe ist sehr naturgetreu. Besonders beeindruckt hat mich die Low-Light-Performance – selbst bei schlechten Lichtverhältnissen gelingen beeindruckende Aufnahmen.Die Akkulaufzeit ist ebenfalls lobenswert. Ich kann das Smartphone den ganzen Tag intensiv nutzen, ohne mir Sorgen um leeren Akku machen zu müssen. Die Schnellladefunktion ist ein weiteres Highlight und sorgt dafür, dass ich das Gerät schnell wieder einsatzbereit habe.Die Benutzeroberfläche ist intuitiv und leicht zu navigieren. Ich schätze die vielfältigen Anpassungsmöglichkeiten, mit denen ich das Smartphone genau nach meinen Vorlieben gestalten kann. Die Konnektivitätsoptionen, einschließlich 5G-Unterstützung, tragen dazu bei, dass ich stets in Verbindung bleibe.Zusammenfassend bin ich absolut zufrieden mit meinem DOOGEE V30T Smartphone. Es bietet eine beeindruckende Leistung, eine großartige Kamera, eine lange Akkulaufzeit und ein attraktives Design – alles zu einem sehr vernünftigen Preis. Ich kann dieses Smartphone jedem empfehlen, der nach einem leistungsstarken und dennoch erschwinglichen Gerät sucht.

Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Cosmicray817', 'Rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': '2 week first impressions, I am very impressed', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024', 'Review Body': 'I bought this Samsung A25 to switch from iPhone to android after my iPhone 13's battery completely died after only a year of use. I was sick and tired of all the little games Apple plays to get you to upgrade early. For context, I use my phone relatively lightly, pretty much only for calling, texting, browsing the internet, watching youtube videos, listening to music, and buying bus/train tickets, so I was comfortable browsing the "budget phone" market.After receiving this phone and putting in my old SIM card, I booted it to life and learned that it was very easy to transfer my photos, contacts, and other important information from my Apple phone to this A25, which I was very happy with. And I have a headphone jack back!!! I am so happy about having one again!!! Installing apps was relatively simple, and learning the functionalities of the phone was a bit of a learning curve coming from an Apple device. However, I have to say that after 2 weeks, I am genuinely quite impressed with the battery longevity, build quality, and speed of this phone. It does everything I need it to do and with relative smoothness and good speed. The battery on this A25, with my regular usage, lasts at least 24 hours, which is a huge upgrade from my old phone where I would constantly have to worry about plugging it in or bringing a portable battery.If you're a person who uses their phone heavily for high-processing tasks such as gaming or video editing, then this A25 probably isn't for you. But for me, this phone is great so far, and if it keeps performing like this in the long-term then I definitely will not be going back to Apple. And for $209, I am really impressed!

product_title: umidigi g9cell phone, android 14 unlocked phones, 12(6+6) gb +128gb/1tb tf expand,dual sim, 50mp camera, 6.75" hd+ 90hz display, ai face & fingerprint unlock, 5000mah android phone (black)
all_reviews:
[{'Reviewer Name': 'R S', 'Rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': 'Awesome price for all the features', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024', 'Review Body': "I love this phone for my spare line I have. I will go over all the cons first, then the pros. I don't like some of the apps they installed (also known as bloatware) and forced ads I have to watch to use them, & almost all of them I can't delete, only force stop them. There isn't a huge amount of them, but some.  I would not mind the bloatware in the phone as long as I can get rid of what I don't want, which isn't the case as they locked them. This is nonsense & although many companies do this practice it's always a negative. Instead of having the fingerprint on the touch screen it's on the power button on this phone. Due to it's very narrow width it's flaky at best to get it to read your fingerprint where it's mostly useless as it is much quicker just to enter your passcode. Also if you press to hard since it's also the power button trying to read your print it will put the screen out on you. This overall is a bad idea. Although the auto adaptive brightness is on by default I noticed it is brighter than desired so I have to manually adjust it frequently, but this is a matter of preference for me. The google widget is locked to it's position on home screen & totally unmovable or removable which is extremely irritating to me as I don't want it. It is frustrating that they lock stuff in this manner. Please let me be very clear I am not throwing this phone under the bus here, but rather pointing out some extremely important things that Umidigi needs to be aware of. The improvements made from the knowledge of these things we consumers aren't happy with is important for them. Now, lets get to the pros of this phone. Storage is awesome with 128G internal and expandable micro SD slot for even more, and the 6 gig of ram is very nice. Price for this phone for it's features is great! 50 megapixel camera does a very nice job, even has a macro that works well, and in the included photo you can see very good depth of field focus from foreground all the way to the back ground. Although I haven't done a lot of photo play with this yet I can assure all of you it's very good for it's price point. I done a couple of tests of game play (see photos) & although not a light speed device it does well. Normal use of apps, scrolling & pulling up web pages is very fast so it's great for me. Comes complete with screen protector & case already to go, but I will say the case is minimal for any protection for the phone as it is pretty thin & more plastic like & very little grip to your hand if your hands are dry, but fits perfectly so to be included is very cool! All settings work pretty well & although Android 14 like my other phone it is different in the user interface in some things that can get one a little out of whack to find some things shall we say. Power/volume up/down are on the right and work great with the case, & it also has a hotkey button on the left you can assign something specific to which is very nice. Love the 3.5mm jack plus the fact it's on the top of the phone. Just a personal preference but it's always in my way if it were to be on bottom of the phone in my opinion. Many phones now don't have that capability so it's a plus in my mind. Sound is very adequate also for it's speaker & ok for me. I plugged it in to power before I even turned it on for the first time and it had 100% battery in the phone. I installed my sim card and micro SD card before first power on & it took off perfectly & google easily took care of loading all of my apps from other phone doing the type C to type C phone to phone connection. Included also is a 15W charger W/type C to type C cable so you will have cable out of the box needed for transferring files to it from old phone. Very thoughtful of them to do this. Being totally unlocked for any carrier is a huge plus for sure, but just a word of note my Boost sim W/AT&T service cranked up and worked like a champ. Screen resolution quality & size is awesome! There are also some themes installed that are very nice too, & there are 6 of them. If you are in the market for a very good 5G phone with a lot of goodies/features for it's price then grab you one of these phones. I do highly recommend it!
Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'mrkeetz', 'Rating': '4.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': "Doesn't Work On Verizon or AT&T", 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2024', 'Review Body': "Really great phone for the price. I broke the screen on my Pixel 6 and while waiting for a replacement I bought this phone to have as a backup. Everything set up as normal and showed connection to Verizon 4G LTE. But I could not make or receive calls or SMS messages. I could use data fine though. Apparently all the major carriers have a whitelist of phones they allow on their network and this isn't one of them. I read other reviews where they mentioned that it wouldn't work on AT&T. So beware that even though the frequencies and bands are good, your provider might just block the phone.The phone is relatively fast, screen is great, camera is really good and having the dual sim/sd card ability is great.
Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'ChuckYeah', 'Rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': 'UMIDIGI enters the 5G world with a BANG! Large Screen, lots of storage, and Android 14.', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024', 'Review Body': "I just love UMIDIGI cell phones. They are very reasonably priced and have lots of power and storage, so they are often a better value than some of the more expensive cell phone brands. One of the issues with the value phones is that they are later introducing some of the features and operating systems that the other brands provide. So, when I saw this 5G, Android 14 UMIDIGI G9 5G Cell Phone on Amazon.com, I snapped it up and had it delivered to Canada. Even with the cost of duty, the price was still very reasonable. I understand it is being released soon on Amazon.ca, but I just couldn't take the chance.This is the very first time, I’m aware of, that UMIDIGI released a 5G phone in North America, which is why I was so eager to pick one up.  Although the 5G platform is not widely available in my area, the great part about this phone is that when it does not find a 5G network, it automatically switches to 4G LTE and seamlessly continues to provide you with the best connection available. If you live in a large city, you’ll likely spend most of your day connected 5G and it is lightning fast comparatively.I really love the 6.75-inch, 90 MHz Eye-care Display. It’s very comfortable to look at everyday and it’s even enjoyable to watch a YouTube video or a Netflix movie on it. I think it’s the perfect size as anything bigger would probably start to feel like you’re carrying a small tablet in your pocket. Despite its large screen, this is amazingly comfortable to carry in your front or back pocket, and you hardly know it’s there.I’ve been using this UMIDIGI G9 5G Cell Phone for about a month now and it is the perfect daily driver. The processor is a solid Unisoc T765 Octa (eight) Core Processor that has 2 large 2.3 GHz Cortex-A73 cores and 6 smaller 2.1 GHz A55 cores on-board. It's a mid-level processor which provides very smooth computing whether your playing, communicating, creating or multitasking, and provides all the power the average user needs.The UMIDIGI G9 has 6GB of installed RAM. This is sufficient for most average users, in fact it's probably lots. If you noticed it comes with 12GB in the description, this is because Android 14 has a Memory Expansion option. It uses an equal amount of your storage space (ROM) as RAM. Now if you know don't know anything about RAM vs ROM (storage) speeds, RAM is almost instantaneous where storage is slower in comparison. However, if a memory-intensive app pushes your 6GB of ram, the expanded ram will jump in and allow your app to continue. I have not yet had a ram issue or a frozen app, whether using the unexpanded 6GB or the expanded 12GB.The G9 comes with 128 GB ROM storage. I consider myself to be an average to intermediate user and I'm currently using about 45 GB or about 1/3 of my storage. This includes 15GB in apps, 8GB of video and audio, 2GB of pictures, and don't forget, the first 13GB is required for your Android 14 operating system.The UMIDIGI G9 comes with dual sim card slots. One slot is a dedicated sim card slot and the other will accept either a second sim or a micro-SD card (up to 1TB). If you don't need more storage, the second sim slot can allow you to carry two phone numbers, like a work number and a personal number, on the same device. This is much better than having to carry two devices.The 5000mAh battery is lasting me about two days on a charge at a low, but comfortable, brightness level. However, I usually charge my phone every night, so I evaluated it during an 18-hour period. On FULL brightness, the G9 had 29% battery; at half, the device had 38% left; and at minimum brightness, the phone held 50% battery life after the full day.The only issue I have with this phone is that it does not come with NFC. This is the feature that allows you to tap your phone to pay with your Debit or Credit card. This is not something I use, but I know many users do. I think in these technological times, TAP should always be standard.If you want a worry-free, large-screen, smooth and reliable cell phone that won't let you down or break the bank, consider the UMIDIGI G9 5G. I chose the GREEN and I really LOVE the colour. It even comes with an installed screen protector and a FREE basic case.
Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Amazon Customer', 'Rating': '3.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': "Will not work on AT&T-- not really 'unlocked for all carriers'.", 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2024', 'Review Body': 'phone seems solid and fast
Read more'}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Beltrán', 'Rating': 'N/A', 'Title': 'N/A', 'Date': 'Reviewed in Spain on October 12, 2024', 'Review Body': 'Umidigi pertenece a un grupo de fabricantes de teléfonos de buen aspecto y funcionalidad manteniendo los precios competitivos. Aunque pasa de la cifra de los 100€ este terminal ofrece un procesador de 8 núcleos, cámara de 50 Mpix, batería de 5000 mAh y una pantalla IPS de 90 Hz, características propias de modelos de gama alta.En el interior de la caja encontraremos lo siguiente:· Manual de instrucciones, en 8 idiomas entre los que se encuentra el español.· Smartphone con una funda protectora y un protector de pantalla ya instalado.· Cargador de 5V, 9V y hasta 12V con 20W de potencia con conexión USB C a USB C· Cable USB C de color rojo· Pin para la extracción de la bandeja dual.Con el terminal en la mano destacamos:En el lateral derecho tenemos el Botón de Power con lector de huellas incorporado.Botones para subir y bajar el volumen.En el lateral izquierdo, la bandeja de la tarjeta dual SIM y el botón adicional configurable.En la parte superior, la conexión para los auriculares y el micrófono de ambienteEn la parte inferior, el conector USB C, micrófono y único altavoz del sistema.En la parte trasera tendremos el Duo de cámaras de 50 Mpix y 2 Mpix, junto al flash LEDAl encender el terminal obtendremos una versión de Android 14 bastante limpia, con el manejo de menú original, pero que tendremos que tunear ligeramente para esquivar el software del fabricante. En mi caso he borrado la tienda, el navegador y las aplicaciones del fabricante, a favor de las originales de Android/Google, y he cambiado el asistente del lateral izquierdo de la pantalla por las noticias de Google. Todo se puede eliminar sin problemas.La pantalla es grande, IPS y con un tamaño de 6,75″ con una resolución de 1600 x 720p y una velocidad de refresco de 90 Hz, más que correcta para el día a día. Echamos en falta el NFC para los pagos, que me ha sorprendido que no lo incluyan cuando los pagos con el móvil están tan extendidos.Destaca también sus 7,9 mm de grosor, que lo hacen realmente fino, y sus 189 gr de peso, que sorprenden sobremanera cuando incluye una batería de 5000 mAh, que lo hacen muy ligero en el día a día.

But if you just need a phone with good functions in all aspects, I think it's a great choice both in terms of price and performance.
Read more"}, {'Reviewer Name': 'Johnny_Amazon®', 'Rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': 'Decent Phone, Solid Price', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024', 'Review Body': 'When you are searching for budget phones, you weigh everything you see about that phone, over the price. You can also go the used phone route and pick like an iPhone or Samsung that's about three to five years old for this price range (under $200). But if you want something brand new and shiny, then there is pretty much one option, and that's generic phones from China. I have already reviewed a couple Doogee phones, and find them very decent phones for their price range, and this one is no different. What is different though, is that this phone right now as of me writing this review, has a $60 off coupon which turns the phone to only $130 plus tax. And for all the features and "phone" that you get from this, this is such an excellent value.First, I really like that they did not skimp on the specs, so you get 8GB of RAM, and 128GB of memory. Don't be fooled by the 20GB faux advertising - the extra 12GB is just virtual memory and doesn't behave like a phone with actual 20GB of RAM would. To sum it up simply, it allows you to have more apps open without them having to refresh/restart when you switch back to them, but doesn't make the phone any faster.The camera is decent if you shoot during the day or in situations with really good lighting. At night, it gets very soft and "smushy", or pixelated like a bad quality video stream. Good for posting on Facebook where they will smush the heck out of your photos anyways.I would extra recommend this phone if you have a business or situation where you wouldn't need this phone is your primary phone. It can be your business phone where the main goal is communication, and not like all the extra fun stuff you'd do on your expensive phone. Or perhaps you need a burner phone for your nefarious ways and lifestyle. Then if something were to happen, being out $130 isn't so bad. It's especially great if you need to travel overseas and want that second phone as a peace of mind.
Read more'}]

[{'Reviewer Name': 'Douglas Scott', 'Rating': '5.0 out of 5 stars', 'Title': 'Great for Remote Meetings!', 'Date': 'Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024', 'Review Body': "I work from home, so I do all my meetings via Teams so this headphone set really comes in handy when I need to have a more private meeting. Headphones are very comfortable lots of soft padding on the ear cuffs and headrest, during those long meeting I sometimes forget I even have them on.They are Bluetooth so they are wireless but can be plugged in if needed.  The charger is very slick.  Just rest the headphones on their side on top of the charging dock and that's it.  They just sit balanced, it's pretty unique and cool.everything is built and feel premium from the headphone, charging dock, even the cloth braided cables it comes with.  JLab did a great job with these headphones...highly recommend.

But I've had JLab earbuds before and they were great. So I figured I'd give these headphones a shot. Right off the bat, I could see they would be very comfortable. The ear covers are mostly flat, but they have some give. In my experience, headphones that have the foam lining around the ear covers (making a little pocket for your ear to go in) end up resting on the tops of my ears and hurting after long periods of use. These headphones don't do that. They also have a sleek mic that slides out. They connect just fine, and they sound even better. I used them right away upon delivery for a couple of hours and they still had plenty of charge left, so the battery life is great. Overall, JLab has once again made a really high quality product for a great price.

As soon as I spoke everyone in the call was shocked at how high quality the microphone was and I sounded crystal clear compared to before.The headset is comfortable and doesn't get too hot on the ears after an hour or so like most work headsets I've tried, which is one of the main reasons I was using earbuds before.The only "negative" that I found was the price. But I should have known from having challenges in the past with JLab gear and Android phones (I can't speak for iPhones).  When put into pairing mode, my phone sees it and asks to pair.  It succeeded and let me use it for calls about 1 in 20 attempts.  The other 19 resulted in it pairing, and then immediately disconnecting or rebooting the phone.  I have an older Samsung S10 Galaxy phone, but it works fine with all other BT devices (my car, workout headset, Galaxy Watch, etc.).  But this device cannot connect or maintain a solid BT connection no matter what I did.So I returned it, and bought a Poly Voyager 4320 for about the same price.  Received it, plugged it in, put it into pairing mode, and immediately paired and maintained the connection just fine.Ultimately if you want to have a reliable (it just works, you don't have to think about it) solution, this - at least from my experience - is not for you.
